short_description: The nTree function is a hierarchical analysis SQL-MR function that can build and traverse tree structures on all worker machines. The function reads the data only once from the disk and creates the trees in memory.
long_description: The nTree function is a hierarchical analysis SQL-MR function that can build and traverse tree structures on all worker machines. The function reads the data only once from the disk and creates the trees in memory.

argument_clauses.name: ROOT_NODE
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the BOOLEAN SQL expression that defines the root nodes of the trees (for example, parent.id IS NULL).
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the BOOLEAN SQL expression that defines the root nodes of the trees (for example, parent_id IS NULL).

argument_clauses.name: NODE_ID
argument_clauses.rDescription:
Specifies the SQL expression whose value uniquely identifies a node in the input table (for example, order_id). 
Note: A node can appear multiple times in the data set, with different parents.
argument_clauses.description:
Specifies the SQL expression whose value uniquely identifies a node in the input table (for example, order_id). 
Note: A node can appear multiple times in the data set, with different parents.

argument_clauses.name: PARENT_ID
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the SQL expression whose value identifies the parent node.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the SQL expression whose value identifies the parent node.

argument_clauses.name: MODE
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the direction of tree traversal from the start node—up to the root node or down to the leaf nodes.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the direction of tree traversal from the start node—up to the root node or down to the leaf nodes.

argument_clauses.name: ALLOW_CYCLES
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether trees can contain cycles. If not, a cycle in the data set causes the function to throw an exception. The default value is 'false'. For information about cycles, refer to “Cycles in ta.ntree”
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether trees can contain cycles. If not, a cycle in the data set causes the function to throw an exception. The default value is 'false'. For information about cycles, refer to “Cycles in nTree”

argument_clauses.name: STARTS_WITH
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the node from which to start tree traversal—must be 'root', 'leaf ', or a SQL expression that identifies a node.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the node from which to start tree traversal—must be 'root', 'leaf ', or a SQL expression that identifies a node.

argument_clauses.name: OUTPUT
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies when to output a tuple—at every node along the traversal path ('all') or only at the end of the traversal path ('end'). The default value is 'end'.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies when to output a tuple—at every node along the traversal path ('all') or only at the end of the traversal path ('end'). The default value is 'end'.

argument_clauses.name: Max_Distance
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the maximum tree depth. The default value is 5.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the maximum tree depth. The default value is 5.

argument_clauses.name: RESULT
argument_clauses.rDescription:
Specifies aggregate operations to perform during tree traversal. The function reports the result of each aggregate operation in the output table. The syntax of aggregate is: 
operation (expression) [ ALIAS alias ] 
operation is either PATH, SUM, LEVEL, MAX, MIN, IS_CYCLE, AVG, or PROPAGATE. expression is a SQL expression. If operation is LEVEL or IS_CYCLE, then expression must be *. 
alias is the name of the output table column that contains the result of the operation. The default value is the string 'operation(expression)' without the quotation marks. For example, PATH(node_name). 
Note: The function ignores alias if it is the same as an input table column name. 
For the path from the Starts_With node to the last traversed node, the operations do the following: 
 PATH: Outputs the value of expression for each node, separating values with '->'. 
 SUM: Computes the value of expression for each node and outputs the sum of these values. 
 LEVEL: Outputs the number of hops. 
 MAX: Computes the value of expression for each node and outputs the highest of these values. 
 MIN: Computes the value of expression for each node and outputs the lowest of these values. 
 IS_CYCLE: Outputs the cycle (if any). 
 AVG: Computes the value of expression for each node and outputs the average of these values. 
 PROPAGATE: Evaluates expression with the value of the starts.with node and propagates the result to every node.
argument_clauses.description:
Specifies aggregate operations to perform during tree traversal. The function reports the result of each aggregate operation in the output table. The syntax of aggregate is: 
operation (expression) [ ALIAS alias ] 
operation is either PATH, SUM, LEVEL, MAX, MIN, IS_CYCLE, AVG, or PROPAGATE. expression is a SQL expression. If operation is LEVEL or IS_CYCLE, then expression must be *. 
alias is the name of the output table column that contains the result of the operation. The default value is the string 'operation(expression)' without the quotation marks. For example, PATH(node_name). 
Note: The function ignores alias if it is the same as an input table column name. 
For the path from the Starts_With node to the last traversed node, the operations do the following: 
 PATH: Outputs the value of expression for each node, separating values with '->'. 
 SUM: Computes the value of expression for each node and outputs the sum of these values. 
 LEVEL: Outputs the number of hops. 
 MAX: Computes the value of expression for each node and outputs the highest of these values. 
 MIN: Computes the value of expression for each node and outputs the lowest of these values. 
 IS_CYCLE: Outputs the cycle (if any). 
 AVG: Computes the value of expression for each node and outputs the average of these values. 
 PROPAGATE: Evaluates expression with the value of the Starts_With node and propagates the result to every node.

argument_clauses.name: LOGGING
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether the function prints log messages. The default value is 'false'.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether the function prints log messages. The default value is 'false'.
